alert.note: Alert for Corson; Dewey; Potter; Stanley; Sully (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 10:56PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Sully, southwestern Corson, southwestern Potter, northwestern Stanley and Dewey Counties through 1245 AM CDT/1145 PM MDT/... At 1155 PM CDT/1055 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Firesteel to 6 miles west of Ridgeview to 9 miles northwest of Mission Ridge to near Sansarc. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ridgeview around 1105 PM MDT. Little Bend Rec Area around 1215 AM CDT. Glencross around 1115 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bush`s Landing, Swiftbird Day School, Swiftbird and Sutton Bay Rec Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT/400 AM MDT/ for central and north central South Dakota.
